company.name: Ardelyx, Inc.
company.one_liner: Commercial-stage GI and nephrology company with two approved products growing >70% YoY — IBSRELA (IBS-C) and XPHOZAH (hyperphosphatemia)
company.company_description: Ardelyx is a commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on developing and commercializing medicines for gastrointestinal and cardiorenal diseases. The company's two approved products — IBSRELA (tenapanor) for IBS-C and XPHOZAH (tenapanor) for hyperphosphatemia in CKD on dialysis — are both based on the same NHE3 inhibitor platform. Both products are experiencing rapid commercial uptake.

investment_thesis_summary.core_thesis: Ardelyx is a rare commercial-stage biotech with two approved products generating >70% annual revenue growth. IBSRELA is the only non-secretagogue for IBS-C, and XPHOZAH is the first new phosphate binder mechanism in decades. Combined peak revenue potential exceeds $2B.
key_value_drivers: IBSRELA: 92% YoY Q3 growth, FY2025 guidance $270-275M, >$1B peak
XPHOZAH: Rapid uptake since relaunch, addressing $4B+ phosphate binder market
Same molecule (tenapanor) with two approved indications = capital efficiency
Next-gen NHE3 inhibitor RDX10531 extends franchise beyond 2033 patent cliff
Clean balance sheet with growing profitability inflection

platform.name: NHE3 Inhibition Platform
platform.description: Ardelyx's platform is built around locally-acting inhibitors of the sodium-hydrogen exchanger 3 (NHE3) on the intestinal epithelium. By blocking sodium absorption in the gut, these molecules increase intestinal fluid (addressing constipation) and reduce phosphate absorption (addressing hyperphosphatemia) with minimal systemic exposure (<1% absorbed).

unique_capabilities.description: Minimally absorbed (<1%) — acts in the GI tract with minimal systemic exposure, reducing off-target effects
NHE3 inhibition addresses both constipation (fluid secretion) and pain (phosphate-mediated TRPV1 mechanism) in IBS-C
Same target (NHE3) validated in two distinct indications (IBS-C and hyperphosphatemia) from a single molecule

assets.name: XPHOZAH
assets.status: FDA approved; relaunched with expanded label

bull_case.point: Revenue acceleration — both products growing >70% YoY
bull_case.evidence: IBSRELA Q3 $78.2M (+92% YoY); combined FY2025 guidance implies >70% growth [Corp '25 S6, S10]

bull_case.point: Only non-secretagogue in IBS-C — structurally differentiated
bull_case.evidence: 77% of patients on secretagogues still symptomatic [Corp '25 S6]

bull_case.point: XPHOZAH addresses massive unmet need in hyperphosphatemia
bull_case.evidence: 50% of dialysis patients have uncontrolled phosphorus despite existing binders [Corp '25 S14]

bear_case.point: Patent cliff in August 2033 limits peak value capture
bear_case.evidence: Tenapanor composition of matter patent expires Aug 2033 [Corp '25 S24]
bear_case.counter_argument: RDX10531 next-gen NHE3 inhibitor in development to extend franchise

bear_case.point: Single molecule risk — both products are tenapanor
bear_case.evidence: Any safety signal would affect both products simultaneously
bear_case.counter_argument: Locally acting with <1% systemic absorption reduces systemic safety risk

key_debates.question: Can IBSRELA reach >$1B peak before Aug 2033 patent expiry?
key_debates.bull_view: Yes — at current trajectory, $1B+ achievable by 2029-2030
key_debates.bear_view: No — market growth may slow; generic Linzess competition
key_debates.what_resolves_it: FY2026 revenue trajectory and TRx growth rates

catalysts_2026.details: Final FY2025 revenue vs $270-275M guidance; FY2026 growth outlook
Tracking IBSRELA and XPHOZAH commercial momentum
Next-gen NHE3 inhibitor progress — key to extending beyond 2033 patent cliff
